portfolio.title: 333gle - Full-Stack SWE
portfolio.description: In the 333gle project, I developed a multithreaded web server with search engine capabilities, similar to Google's infrastructure. The server, managed by a central HttpServer, efficiently handles client connections using a dynamic ThreadPool. Leveraging the HttpServer_ThrFn() function, requests are parsed and routed dynamically, mirroring Google's query processing. Having integrated web server functionalities with search capabilities, this project showed me the fascinating resemblance to industry-leading search engines like Google.

portfolio.title: GamesInOne - Back-End SWE
portfolio.description: In GamesInOne, a Windows application, I orchestrated backend processes to seamlessly organize and launch all applications from a centralized platform. By implementing robust checks for file processes and optimizing backend logic, I ensured data integrity and efficient database interactions. Collaborating closely with cross-functional teams, I facilitated seamless integration and proactively resolved backend issues, contributing to the app's success. With features like user account integration, game organization, and bug reporting, GamesInOne enhances gaming management for users.

portfolio.title: Pathfinder - Full-Stack SWE
portfolio.description: Pathfinder involves crafting a user-friendly GUI for a route finder tool, integrating React for frontend and Spark Framework for backend development. Utilizing MVC architecture and event-driven programming, users can input starting and ending locations to view routes on a UW campus map. Emphasizing simplicity and clarity, the GUI facilitates intuitive route requests and displays results effectively. Witnessing the project's resemblance to Google Maps was incredibly thrilling
